p: On the other side, several studies have shown that many ancient ARGs retained their function when expressed in either homologous or heterologous hosts (Dâ€™Costa et al. 2011; Bhullar et al. 2012; Perron et al. 2015; Perry et al. 2016). However, the link between environmental ARGs and antibiotic-resistant human pathogens is not always clear. Hence, it has been proposed that more efforts should be made to test the hypothesis that some of these ancient ARGs might be transmitted to modern microbes by horizontal gene transfer (HGT); it has also been highlighted the importance to measure the rate of these HGT events, as well as to assess the environmental factors contributing to such genetic exchange (Wright 2010).
